name: My Seizure Gauge In-hospital Wearable Recordings
citation: Brinkmann, Benjamin (2025) My Seizure Gauge In-hospital Wearable Recordings (Version draft) [Data set]. DANDI Archive. https://dandiarchive.org/dandiset/001467/draft
description: The My Seizure Gauge project is a multicenter effort to build an openly sharable, multimodal wearable dataset that pairs long-duration biosensor recordings with concurrently validated EEG seizures to advance ambulatory seizure-forecasting research. In this release we include: 87 Empatica E4 wristband sessions with 387 captured seizures; 38 ByteFlies chest-patch sessions with 156 seizures; 10 GeneActiv regular wrist-accelerometer sessions with 0 seizures and 15 high-resolution GeneActiv-1 kHz sessions with 25 seizures; 40 Epilog wrist recordings with 68 seizures; 51 IMEC ECG-patch sessions with 121 seizures; 17 Biovotion Everion armbands with 62 seizures; 9 Dexcom glucose traces with 171 seizures; and 3 Equivital belt recordings with 4 seizures. This amounts to 994 EEG-verified seizure events across 270 device-specific datasets.
acknowledgement: Funded by the Epilepsy Foundation Innovation Institute
